page.description: Returns Words (case sensitive) that are not in the exclude list.
page.prototype: New_List as C = WORD_SUBTRACTC(C Words,C Exclude_Words[,C Delimiter])

argument.name: Words
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of words or entries to examine.

argument.name: Delimiter
argument.description: Optional. Default = CR-LF. A character string that separates words or entries.

page.discussion: WORD_SUBTRACTC() removes all of the words or entries in Old_List from the list of words or entries in Find_Words. The words in Find_Words are separated by the CR-LF delimiter. This function is typically used in Xbasic programs to remove one list of CR-LF delimited words from another list of CR-LF delimited words. Note : For a case insensitive function, use WORD_SUBTRACT().
page.example: dim list1 as C dim list2 as C dim list3 as C biglist1=<<%a% one two three four %a% biglist2 = <<%a% one two three four %a% removelist=<<%a% one two %a%

section.description: In the first case, the delimiter of biglist1 is assumed to be a whitespace character, so the operation succeeds. In the second case, where the delimiter of biglist1 is specified to be CR-LF, the operation fails.
section.example: ? word_subtract(biglist1, removelist) = three four ? word_subtract(biglist1, removelist, crlf() ) = one two three four

section.description: In both cases the operation succeeds, because biglist2 is delimited by CR-LF characters.
section.example: ? word_subtract(biglist2, removelist) = three four ? word_subtract(biglist2, removelist, crlf() ) = three four

page.limitations: The Find_Words argument is case sensitive.
